thread.title: Silt-laden waters of Punjab Rivers.

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Silt-laden waters of Punjab Rivers.
text: AT the recent conference of the Karachi Chamber of Commerce with the Finance Member of the Government of India the Hon'ble Mr. Webb, in mentioning the irrigation needs of Sind, called attention to the great loss caused to the soil properties of the country by allowing the silt-laden waters run to waste. Speaking for Sind Mr. Webb said: "though we are situated in a most useful portion of the great Indus Valley with an immense perennial supply of invaluable of silt-laden water running through our midst the irrigation officers have been allowed to argue with each other for several decades over the problem of perennial canals for Sind, with the result that one of the greatest schemes of irrigation in India is still held up.‚Äù
